intro: Gymnadenia conopsea, commonly known as the pink fairycup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its distinctive pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, moist habitats such as meadows and woodlands, often in areas with well-drained soil. Its leaves are grass-like and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers are borne on a single, erect stem. Gymnadenia conopsea is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
